intro: Aotus coccinea, commonly known as the red batwing plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red, velvety bracts that resemble the wings of a bat, hence its common name. It produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Aotus coccinea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and unique floral display.
